instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3071: What is 820-3071? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
threads.message:
Hi,

Is it possible to disable GPU in an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A? The hardware mod is the same of the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A?
If so, can i remove <RESISTOR>R8810</RESISTOR> to disable power to GPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
threads.message:
This board accepts the easiest way to disable GPU.
Always disable GPU power supply for such conversion; removing <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>/01, in this case.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
threads.message: Sorry... what is the best way to remove VCC of VGA from L8960 and L8930? I'm not seeing it

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
threads.message:
"removing <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>/01, in this case."
This is good enough, to disable the GPU power supply.

If you like, remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>/31/61 and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>; may reuse them.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU
